div.span: All school buildings closed for remainder of school year | Remote Learning to continue

header.h2: All school buildings closed for remainder of school year | Remote Learning to continue

span.content: All school buildings closed for remainder of school year | Remote Learning to continue

div.span: Date: Thursday, March 12, 2020 (All day) to Thursday, May 21, 2020 (All day)

div.p: Denver metro area school superintendents announced Friday, April 3, that school districts will remain closed to in-building learning for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

p.strong: Remote learning and modified operations will remain in place for the district through Thursday, May 21.
As a reminder, you can visit Community Letters & Resources for:

li.p: A growing list of learning resources
Talking points and resources for families to talk to children about COVID-19
Information about the district's grab and go food plan

p.em: During this rapidly evolving situation, more information will be communicated at the link above in the days and weeks to come.

hr.p: Superintendentes del área metropolitana de Denver anuncian el viernes, 3 de abril, que los distritos escolares permanecerán cerrados al aprendizaje en persona por el resto del año escolar 2019-2020.

p.strong: El aprendizaje remoto y las operaciones modificadas permanecerán para el distrito hasta el jueves, 21 de mayo.
Como recordatorio, puede visitar Cartas y recursos para la comunidad para:

li.p: Una lista creciente de recursos de aprendizaje
Temas de conversación y recursos para que las familias hablen con niños acerca de COVID-19
Información sobre el plan de comidas recoger y llevar del distrito

p.em: Durante esta situacion rapidamente cambiante, comunicaremos más información en el enlace anterior en los días y semanas por venir.

header.h3: Employees of the Year and Employee Awards as Nominated By Peers

div.div: Though we are not together this spring, we still have incredible employees to celebrate for the great year we had! We continue to ELEVATE student success, in school or at home, by recognizing the great work all our employees do each day for our students. From teachers to custodians, principals to ...

h2.a: Five Star Community Encouraged to take the 2020 Census

span.content: Five Star Community Encouraged to take the 2020 Census

header.h3: 2020 Census now available to take online, by mail or in person.

div.div: The United States 2020 Census is here! Be in the know about how the census helps our community and how important it is to participate. Every household will have the option of responding online, by mail, by phone or in person by responding to a census enumerator. 2020 Census: What is the Census? ...

a.title: Five Star Community Encouraged to take the 2020 Census

h2.a: 2020 Aim for the Stars Scholarship - Deadline Extended Again

span.content: 2020 Aim for the Stars Scholarship - Deadline Extended Again

header.h3: Multi-year scholarship - you can now apply by May 10

div.div: Adams County and Adams 12 Five Star Schools Aim for the Stars Scholarship is a multi-year scholarship. Yearly scholarship award will be divided evenly between the Fall and Spring semesters. Click here to apply! To be eligible, students must be: Scheduled to graduate in May 2020 from a high school ...

a.title: 2020 Aim for the Stars Scholarship - Deadline Extended Again

Find the best fit for your child.
Students can apply to attend schools outside of their attendance area boundary.
Investing in every student, every school, every community.

Adams 12 Five Star Schools will conduct an Interest Based Strategies Negotiations meeting on April 29, 2020 from 8:00-11:00 am. The meeting will be live streamed and accessible through the link below:
Please click here for the agenda.
This meeting is open to the public. For additional information contact Cindy Douma, Sr. Executive Assistant, at (720) 972-4071.
Si necesita ayuda en español, comuníquese con Cindy Douma y ella conseguirá un intérprete para usted.
Adams 12 Five Star Schools will conduct an Interest Based Strategies Negotiations meeting on May 4, 2020 from 8:00-10:00 am. The meeting will be live streamed and accessible through the link below:
This meeting is open to the public. For additional information contact Cindy Douma, Sr. Executive Assistant, at (720) 972-4071.
Si necesita ayuda en español, comuníquese con Cindy Douma y ella conseguirá un intérprete para usted.

p.br: This will be a remote electronic meeting and can be viewed live on Five Star YouTube via the video camera link in the agenda in BoardDocs. The link will be available just prior to the start of the meeting.

div.span: Educational Support Center - Mt. Lincoln Room

header.h3: Adams 12 Kids Identified With Dyslexia (KID) Parent Group

div.p: This is a monthly meeting hosted by the Adams 12 (Kids Identified with Dyslexia) KID parent group.
Attendees will have an opportunity to connect with other parents of students who are identified with dyslexia and learn more about the support and resources available to them.
The meetings are held on the second Monday of every month at the Educational Support Center (ESC) 1500 E. 128th Ave, Thornton, CO. in the Mt. Lincoln Meeting Room
Learn more about the Adams 12 KID group by following them on facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/Adams12KidsIdentifiedwithDyslexia

div.div: Adams 12 Five Star Schools will conduct an Interest Based Strategies Negotiations meeting on May 14, 2020 from 8:00-11:00 am. The meeting will be live streamed and accessible through the link below:
This meeting is open to the public. For additional information contact Cindy Douma, Sr. Executive Assistant, at (720) 972-4071.
Si necesita ayuda en español, comuníquese con Cindy Douma y ella conseguirá un intérprete para usted.

h2.a: American Indian Education (Title 6) Youth Advocacy Program

span.content: American Indian Education (Title 6) Youth Advocacy Program

header.h3: Program To Host Open Feedback Meeting on April 30, 2020

div.div:
Adams 12 Five Star Schools supports American Indian students and families through the Native American Youth Advoacy program that serves students K-12. The program also sponsors the AIPAC (American Indian Parent Advisory Committee (AIPAC) that meets monthly. Proposed 2020-21 Plan
Read the proposed 2020-21 plan for the advocacy program. If you would like to provide feedback ...

div.div:
February 2020 Update
Thank you for your ongoing engagement and feedback regarding potential adjustments to bell schedules for the 2020-21 school year. As a result of the January feedback and survey (see below), the final decision regarding bell schedules will be between Scenario #3 (a 30-minute later start at High School, Middle School and Elementary) and the Current Schedule. ...

a.title: Bell Schedule Review

li.a: Read more about Bell Schedule Review

h2.a: Latest graduation rates highlight decade-long climb

span.content: Latest graduation rates highlight decade-long climb

header.h3: All district comprehensive high schools continue to outpace state average

div.p: Continuing a trend that highlighted the past decade, the four-year on time graduation rate for Adams 12 Five Star Schools again increased for the Class of 2019 to its highest point ever.
The district’s graduation rate reached 84.9* percent in 2019. The new mark is not only the district’s highest graduation rate since the state changed ...

a.title: Latest graduation rates highlight decade-long climb

li.a: Read more about Latest graduation rates highlight decade-long climb

h2.a: District outlines deadlines for 2020-2021 Choice process

span.content: District outlines deadlines for 2020-2021 Choice process

header.h3: Second round of Choice applications accepted through March 30, 2020

div.p: Last year, Adams 12 Five Star Schools received more than 4,500 Choice applications for the 2019-2020 school year. In accordance with the state’s open enrollment law, the district’s Choice program allows for students to apply to attend schools outside of their attendance area boundary.
Both in-district and out-of-district students can apply for Choice. Out-of-district Choice requests ...

a.title: District outlines deadlines for 2020-2021 Choice process

li.a: Read more about District outlines deadlines for 2020-2021 Choice process

h2.a: How to know when inclement weather will impact school

span.content: How to know when inclement weather will impact school

header.h3: Weather impacts to schools are communicated in multiple ways

div.p: Inclement weather can come at any time and Adams 12 Five Star Schools uses a variety of resources to determine if conditions exist that will impact schools.
The district closely monitors weather reports and road conditions and makes a decision regarding school on a daily basis between the following three options :

a.title: How to know when inclement weather will impact school
